conversion_verification.notes: The 3D render successfully demonstrates all mandatory characteristics of a true 3D conversion.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Walls have clear height (5), thickness (5), and interior volume is well perceived (4). Proper 3D wall corners are present (3). Angled view is excellent (5), interior visible from elevated perspective (3). Minimal perspective distortion (2). Roof/ceiling is cleanly removed (5), interior spaces are fully visible (3). Clean geometry without broken sections (2).

geometric_accuracy.notes: Correct number of rooms (3), correct adjacency (4). Relative room proportions are largely preserved but some areas appear slightly compressed (2). Major room identities match (2). Major wall positions align well with 2D (5). Wall lengths are mostly proportional (3). Internal partitions are correctly placed (2). Doors are present and on correct walls, but some are missing (3). Windows are largely missing or simplified greatly (1). Openings are proportionally sized and oriented where present (2).

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (beds, sofas, tables) (4). Kitchen elements present (2). Bathroom fixtures present (2). Furniture is placed in correct rooms (3). Furniture scale is reasonable (2). Orientation is logical (2).

visual_clarity.notes: Walls, floors, openings are clearly distinguishable (4). Geometry is readable and not confusing (4). Interior is clearly visible (3). Lighting does not obscure geometry (3). Consistent material usage (2). No major rendering artifacts (2). Clean background presentation (0 - black background is acceptable, but if there were text elements in the 3D, it would be 0).

detected_errors.description: Some doors shown in the 2D plan are not clearly visible or are missing in the 3D render (e.g., entrance to BED-3, entrance to FOYER from Kitchen area is simplified).
Windows are either completely missing (e.g., in BED-1, BED-2) or heavily simplified to small openings without distinct window frames.
Relative room proportions seem slightly altered in some areas, making some rooms appear more compressed (e.g., Foyer, Utility) or slightly stretched compared to the 2D plan.
The overall aesthetic is very white and minimalist, which while clean, makes it hard to distinguish some fixtures from walls/floors without clearer material differentiation.

summary: The 3D transformation is a good conversion from the 2D floor plan, demonstrating clear 3D fundamentals and mostly accurate geometric representation, though with minor discrepancies in room proportions and missing window details.
